doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 52 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 12/22/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 52 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 12/22/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Joyce Hunter, Darrell Yates Rist, and Tom Stoddard2. Discussion of particular problems homosexuals face during the holiday season, including coming out to parents, bringing partner to holiday dinner, coping with intolerant family3. AIDS transmission outside the bloodstream, and ability to infect tissue, and the New York Times' continuing bias of male anal sex as primary method of infection4. State's Constitutional rights in light of the Bowers v Hardwick sodomy case decision5. Discussion of "gifts" each guest has received this year, including the strengthening of the gay community in the national spotlightCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine6. Andy Humm on enlightening the ignorant through vocal support for gay rightsCOMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey7. Hotline for latest treatments for AIDS and experimental treatments8. Federal government's AIDS hotline becomes privatized, is expanding to 24 hours, moving to NYC9. Lee University in Pennsylvania grants official status to a gay, lesbian, and bisexual student group10. 62 new AIDS education PSAs used to educate average TV viewer, starring an assortment of Hollywood celebrities11. Lesbian woman ends legal fight over her dismissal from the ROTC in 198212. Newly adopted Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986 continues to include language that can be used to ban gay people from entering the country13. Philadelphia, police commissioner appoints a liaison to the gay community and commits to fully investigating complaints of anti-gay violence and hate14. Sports Report, with clips of Greg Louganis performing a circus act15. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in History with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: The Monster2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of off-Broadway musical, "Have I Got a Girl for You!"COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine3. Michael Weyand interviews Walter Williams about his study of homosexuality in Native American culture, "The Spirit and the Flesh"COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation4. Reminder from Razor Sharp to contact those friends who do not have families5. $100.000 gained in an art auction to benefit five AIDS organizations in San Francisco
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 52 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 12/22/1986]: December 1986
